page.title: 11Longridge Estate
page.content: The Longridge Estate as it existed prior to its being broken up formed the largest part of th district under review.Consisting of approximately 3200 acres it belonged at one time to a family named Orde who lived in or in the vicinity of Horncliffe.The property then changed into the hands of the Liddle family,a daughter named Annie married a wealthy gentleman by the name of Mather,on his death she married Hubert Jerningingham in 1874. At the time there was great speculation as to where the "Mather Millions" came from and it is possible that this money was used to build the Mansion House of Longridge Towers 1878.The building was very elaborate,built of cold grey stone with arched front entrance and a high tower,and the grounds were set out with grass terraces,beautiful tree
